title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 April 2012 - XWiki
content:

07:38 <CIA-160> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* ref5e70d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/ef5e70d858ea431e0b59e112933acec1805fa8e7 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-152: Upgrade to Apache commons-io 2.3 ...

07:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:00 <CIA-160> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-3.5.x \* r59d164a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/59d164a1c60a03a6c739e6c81abc59befebd56bf / (3 files): [release] Updated translations - http://git.io/GiVleQ  
08:09 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Where is mentioned the Java version that XWiki requires?  
08:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HPrerequisites  
08:20 <@sdumitriu> I thought so  
08:20 <@sdumitriu> Shouldn't we mention that somewhere more visible?  
08:21 <@sdumitriu> That's about installation, but it isn't mentioned in the development practices  
08:21 <@sdumitriu> Something under http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SupportStrategy  
08:21 <vmassol> it could be mentionned in the tools section of dev.xwiki.org  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> Yes, there as well  
08:22 <vmassol> but no dup  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> (we do mention Java, but not what version)  
08:22 <vmassol> needs a Prerequisites page  
08:22 <vmassol> included from different places  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> We should also mention which JDKs are supported  
08:22 <vmassol> sorry sdumitriu, got to go  
08:22 <vmassol> need to go to the conference for the last day  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> It's important to say that we don't support the GNU ones  
08:22 <@sdumitriu> K, bye  
08:23 <vmassol> has quit

09:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: How do I fix the issue with rendering-standalone and maven 3.0.4?  
09:25 <@sdumitriu> It blocks the release at the moment  
09:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: what is the problem?  
09:26 <vmassol> if you do the release on the same machine, I don't think you'll have some issues  
09:26 <@sdumitriu> The big warning on top of http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
09:26 <vmassol> actually I'm not 100% sure of what works/what doesn't work  
09:26 <@sdumitriu> [FATAL] Non-resolvable parent POM: Could not find artifact org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering:pom:3.5-SNAPSHOT and 'parent.relativePath' points at wrong local POM @ line 3, column 11  
09:26 <@sdumitriu>     for project org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-standalone:3.5-SNAPSHOT at /home/hudsonagent/releases/xwiki-trunks/xwiki-rendering/target/checkout/xwiki-rendering-standalone/dependency-reduced-pom.xml for project org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-standalone:3.5-SNAPSHOT at /home/hudsonagent/releases/xwiki-trunks/xwiki-rendering/target/checkout/xwiki-rendering-standalone/dependency-reduced-pom.xml  
09:26 <vmassol> even on 3.0.3 it doesn't wor perfectly well  
09:27 <vmassol> you might need to remove artifacts from the local repo first  
09:27 <vmassol> org.xwiki.commons artifacts  
09:27 <vmassol> again I'm not sure  
09:27 <vmassol> mflorea might know more  
09:28 <+mflorea> I've fixed it  
09:28 <+mflorea> I removed commons/pom and commons-pom from local repo on agent-5  
09:28 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't think that fixes it  
09:28 <vmassol> because I was able to reproduce locally  
09:28 <vmassol> so the issue is still here IMO  
09:28 <+mflorea> it fixed it on CI  
09:29 <vmassol> ah yes temporarily  
09:29 <vmassol> I had already done what you did on agent5 a few days before  
09:29 <vmassol> and it came back  
09:29 <+mflorea> not temporary, thomas cleared local repos on all agents yesterday I think, that's why the issue reappeared  
09:29 <vmassol> well I can reprodcue locally  
09:29 <vmassol> so it's definitely not fixed IMO  
09:29 <vmassol> wdyt?  
09:30 <vmassol> s/can/could/  
09:30 <vmassol> (haven't tried again in the past few fays)  
09:30 <vmassol> days  
09:31 <+mflorea> I was able to reproduce it locally too, but removing the two poms I mentioned fixed the problem for me, and for CI  
09:31 <vmassol> so you cannot reproduce anymore locally mflorea?  
09:31 <vmassol> I just want to know if the problem is solved forever or not  
09:31 <vmassol> ;:)  
09:32 <+mflorea> the problem can reappear for sure  
09:33 <+mflorea> xwiki-rendering-standalone builds fine for me locally, but it depends on what you have on local repo  
09:33 <+mflorea> I don't know what  we can do untill the bug in maven/maven shade plugin is fixed..  
09:37 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: strange, it remember it worked for me with 3.0.4 if commons and rendering were build locally. What you can try now is to remove the xwiki-commons:pom and xwiki-commons-pom:pom from local repo before building/releasing rendering

13:17 <+sburjan> Edy  closed the issue, so it should be fixed, but I want to make sure  
13:17 <+sburjan> I'll give you an answer in one hour, ok ?

15:32 <CIA-160> tmortagne stable-4.0.x \* rb50578b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b50578b3c5fffeaa6346d6709877cc8cd93ee1f9 / (4 files): Update translations - http://git.io/JIuJbA

15:53 <vmassol> has quit  
15:58 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I am still able t o reproduce your issue  
16:00 <+sburjan> re-opening issue.  
16:01 <+Enygma`> sburjan: hmm  
16:01 <+Enygma`> did you use the xar I`ve attached to the issue?  
16:01 <+sburjan> no, I used the xar from the build  
16:01 <+Enygma`> I mean the test page xar  
16:02 <+Enygma`> I`ve attached an input page that I`ve used to reproduce the problem  
16:03 <+sburjan> I've used the steps I did on the issue, but this time I added reply to reply to a commment.. basically 3 level comments  
16:04 <+sburjan> what should I do with the xar from the issue page ?  
16:05 <+Enygma`> the xar I`ve uploaded is a page that contains objects according to the issue's description  
16:05 <+Enygma`> you import that into a 2.7.2 database  
16:05 <+sburjan> and I'm still not able to add annotations after migration  
16:05 <+Enygma`> the upgrade the war and xar  
16:05 <+Enygma`> and see how the page is migrated  
16:05 <+sburjan> well I am still able to reproduce without your xar ?  
16:05 <+Enygma`> make sure you have the latest build  
16:05 <+sburjan> basically I get the same state as yesterday  
16:06 <+Enygma`> checking the build...  
16:06 <+sburjan> I am using the latest snapshot from today .. the xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.0-20120420.113732-200.zip  
16:07 <CIA-160> tmortagne stable-4.0.x \* r1ce44fa https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1ce44faf550b6cdcc5829444e1e8331fe0565476 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-rendering/xwiki-platform-rendering-macros/xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-code/pom.xml : XWIKI-6746: Upgrade to Pygments 1.5 - http://git.io/bsk1DQ  
16:07 <+sburjan> and latest xar: xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.0-20120420.113732-200.zip  
16:07 <+sburjan> \* xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-4.0-20120420.113346-201.xar  
16:09 <+Enygma`> yep, the builds seem to have gone well  
16:09 <+sburjan> can you check if you can reproduce it too ?  
16:09 <+Enygma`> ok, I will check  
16:09 <+Enygma`> but please give me a proper input  
16:10 <+Enygma`> like the xar page that I have attached to the issue  
16:10 <+sburjan> well the steps are the same as yesterday.. do you want a XAR with that page ?  
16:10 <+Enygma`> yes  
16:11 <+Enygma`> with the page before the upgrade  
16:11 <+Enygma`> OR, you could first use the xar that I have provided  
16:11 <+Enygma`> and tell me if, on that xar, the issue still exists  
16:11 <+sburjan> okay, checking now your XAR  
16:12 <+Enygma`> ok  
16:14 <+Enygma`> wait  
16:14 <+Enygma`> :)  
16:14 <+Enygma`> I think I was too tired last night and committed only on master :)  
16:17 <+sburjan> :)  
16:17 <+Enygma`> there's something wrong on jenkins  
16:17 <+sburjan> so should I abort testing ?  
16:18 <+Enygma`> looks like the master platform commits triggered a jenkins master platform build (normal) but which in turn triggered a 4.0 platform jenkins build (useless) as well, which in turn triggered a 4.0 enterprise build (useless)  
16:18 <+Enygma`> that's why I thought the builds were OK  
16:19 <+Enygma`> yes, I am cherry-picking the commits into the 4.0 branch now  
16:19 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: looking, I tough I had fixed all theses dependencies issues on jenkins  
16:19 <+sburjan> tmortagne: : I will check monday the Annotations MIgration. Edy found some issue on Jenkins, so I can't test the annotations migration on 4.0 branch.  
16:19 <+Enygma`> sburjan: in the meanwhile, you could do the test on 4.1-SNAPSHOT to save time  
16:19 <+Enygma`> since it's the same thing  
16:20 <+sburjan> so everything related to the merge is committed in 4.0 too ? maybe a fix that is not common could impact  
16:20 <+Enygma`> in 4.1, yes  
16:21 <+sburjan> I'd feel more secure on testing 4.0, but if you guarantee the 4.0 and 4.1 is identical (in terms of the annotations and merge feature) it's ok  
16:21 <+Enygma`> yep, no new commits in 4.1  
16:21 <+sburjan> ok, testing 4.1 now  
16:21 <+tmortagne> hmm I don't understand wht jenkins think xwiki-platform-4.0 depends on xwiki-platform  
16:22 <+tmortagne> there is nothing in the conf saying that  
16:22 <+tmortagne> it's supposed to find dependencies from the pom.xml  
16:24 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:24 <+sburjan> Enygma`: testing latest 4.1 snapshot  
16:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:27 <CIA-160> Eduard Moraru stable-4.0.x \* rffc1d1a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ffc1d1ae3dd59b911fed66634fe665d9d8650c46 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/io/internal/DefaultIOService.java : XWIKI-7744: Stacktrace when adding an annotation - http://git.io/txkUkw  
16:27 <CIA-160> Eduard Moraru stable-4.0.x \* rd0230b5 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/d0230b520dcdec078c6bb1c73fcd462ed696b4c7 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/internal/CheckAnnotationClassEventListener.java : XWIKI-7747: Right after an migration to 4.0, the current Annotations class is not updated and new annotations are not created properly - http://git.io/9zaCyg  
16:27 <CIA-160> Eduard Moraru stable-4.0.x \* r07cd2f4 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/07cd2f4293e47a5a45dc5cf83491ca109f565a34 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/io/internal/migration/hibernate/R40001XWIKI7540DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7745: Migration of Annotations and Comments to 4.0 breaks page consistency - http://git.io/X-bsKw  
16:38 <+Enygma`> sburjan: the next 4.0 build should contain the fixes.  
16:39 <+sburjan> cool, I'll perform a final check on monday  
16:41 <+Enygma`> yep, in the meanwhile, please let me know (when you finish) if it is still reproducible on 4.1-SNAPSHOT  
16:42 <+sburjan> done. everything looks ok using 4.1  
16:43 <+sburjan> only thing is that I have annos, comments, annos again (added after migration) but this is not a bug it's just an ordering issue  
16:44 <+Enygma`> it's ordered by date  
16:45 <+Enygma`> since you start by adding 10 annotations, then add 10 comments and then 10 replies  
16:45 <+Enygma`> the result will be ordered:  
16:45 <+Enygma`> 10 annotations, 10 comments (each with 1 reply)  
16:45 <+Enygma`> and finally, whatever you annotations you add after the migration, will be last  
16:48 <+sburjan> ok, then it's all good  
16:48 <+sburjan> date makes the most sense  
16:48 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki
